It started off as an exciting open world game, with amazing potential, but it has devolved over time. Endgame is doing your daily chores then logging off, waiting for the next minigame drop. Clearly they've made their money, and have lost the passion for the game.

I havent played the game but based of the fandom I really like it. I need help with something though. When ever it says start I press start and then a loading screen pops up saying "wear head phones for a better expirience." I redownloaded it multiple times and I even switched servers. Maybe its because the first time I downloaded it I deleted it cause I thought it took too long to load. Hoyoverse please help me.

Genshin Imapact is one of the games that last on me and the game that made me comeback to playing computer games. The graphics alone is unique on its own. The gameplay is rather simple but took me a while to learn. The story quests are excellent, that every quest that I do is something to remember. I do wish that as you move forward and add more in the game, you in mihoyo will still keep the game as it is. Thank you.

It's the best MMORPG game so far at least for those who can afford it and it's very difficult to enjoy the game and all of it's features if ur a free to play player that is. I just wish If u guys could improve the amount of primogems u can get when doing quest and domains. This could at least improve the game just a bit especially on this recent update for inuzama and it's characters and weapon banners

I played various types of games but Genshin Impact is different in so many ways.. The best part was obviously the animation and play style.. And the story line or lore is also very great too! Not to mention the interesting characters with their background and everything.. Overall it's one of the best games I've ever played!

I absolutely adore this game. There are so many characters to collect and storylines to discover. I have three suggestions though. 1) Make it a little easier for F2P players to get primogems, as it is pretty difficult to get a large amount. 2) Immediately stop challenges or anything with a timer if wifi goes out. 3) Save spots in ruins so we don't have to redo the whole thing over. Overall, this game is amazing and I recommend it to anyone and everyone@

I am super surprised it has as low ratings as it does. This game is amazing, they keep up on bugs and updates. They have made an incredible game for a mobile app. It's available on more than just mobile too. It's addicting, I've been playing for almost a year and have loved every bit. Can play alone or with friends

This was so awesome this is the very first time I played an rpg in phone that has many environmental interactions the elemwnt effects was also good factor the controls are good the story was good hidden chest and dungeons puzzles almost everything was here expect for underwater exploration but there's only thing I wish...that we can play it offline for some other players that doesn't have a wifi or a strong signal of data so we can still enjoy this game

I really like playing genshin impact, u can explore a lot of places and stuff,and thank u genshin for fixing my problem, I got my account back. But another problem is that I always disconnect because I have "low Wi-Fi". My WiFi is fine but I keep disconnecting, well it's not a big deal but it's kinda annoying, It would be great if it'd get fixed. Well I don't know if it's my device's problem because it also happened on my tablet, but maybe u can try to fix it pls, Thank you.

Wow! The game is very amazing! The graphics so fabulous! I love the game very much! I suggest this game to my friends and family! My phone very not lagging while playing! My phone really can withstand the ultra high graphics! I love the story, the music is the most bestest! I would like to travel with Paimon in real life! I hope Paimon can be playable character.

At first because of the 149mb download I thought it wasn't going to take up as much space as did, and kinda got backhanded when i saw the assets to be downloaded were 7Gigs+ at the time, though I also didnt expect the level of immersion it came with either. Its 100% worth it the graphics, gameplay, I only wish I'd known the enirety of my device space would become devoted to this app (and honkai which I got sometime after)

Beautiful game, both the lands and the characters are visually pleasing, wish there were more darker skinned characters though. There's a lot of stuff you can buy but I've been playing for a few years and am proud to say I haven't spent a dime, even with that I still have so much fun playing and am not opposed to spending in the future.

The rank ascendsions shouldn't be so much of a frustration to just continue the storyline and seem to be a way of getting players to quit playing due to difficulty. Don't get me wrong, it's a lovely game, but to do thr storyline only for there to be places where adventure rank locks seems counterproductive when it is used to progress story

You may find it fun for the first few hours, but after that, its just a long boring grind, with alot of filler events and time limit challenges. The graphics and music are above average, but the gameplay, enemies, exploration etc are mediocre at best. Dont waste your time on this game, you will never feel rewarded for your time. It also heats up your device very fast, has significant loading times, and does not make good use of being open world. Waited 1 year for a big disappointment.

Just wow, what a game. It's incredible how much content there is, for free! You can actually play the game without spending a dollar in it, there is no actual content behind a pay-wall unless you really want a specific character. You get a generous amount of free "wishes" (loot box for characters and specific weapons pretty much) at the start of the game, with many more as you progress the story and quests. I've spent hundreds of hours in the game without paying a dime. Just incredible.

It has extraordinary graphics , the story , the character are all so beautiful created . It's a wonderful game. You slowly build your characters explore their backstories which inturn better connects us to the game and it's characters. The background, the music it's all flawless.

I love this game. The graphics are beautiful, I'm able to play with my friends on multiple platforms. The characters are engaging and fun, the lore is immersive and interesting. It feels like there are some content droughts every once in a while, but events make up for it. The Gacha is a little expensive but not more than any other game. I have fun and enjoy it greatly.
Repeated and boring daily quest. Run through the whole maps just to get 10 primo. Too much unskipped story. High ms. And not even an f2p friendly game.

It's such a good game the graphics are so good! But the downloading this is kinda long I'm surprised there's no lag on my game since some others has experience some lag or my device is just like this- but some players have alot of difficulties downloading the game due too low storage or device can't handle the game due too high graphics but the game itself is great I enjoy the game alot!!!!!

So the game is fun interactive and well made put the app itself is pretty trash. I play on pc and can fight bosses with ease. But when i play on the app the buggy laggy Nd bad controls make it very hard to do anything short of daily commissions and small task. The game is great but the app needs a massive amount of work.

I really, really like this game! It's fun, all the characters are really cool, the storyline is awesome, I like (almost) everything about this game. LiSa kEePs dYiNg lol my reason for four stars is because the controls are a little wonky on mobile. I've fallen off cliffs five times because for some reason my characters go in full circles before actually turning around. But other than that, I love this game and I won't be bored! It's like a mixture between Skyrim and Kingdom Hearts and I love it

I could definitely say that genshin has the most best graphics in the game so far i have played a lot of adventure games but this is in a whole new level tho it is a little bummer that a lot of travelers has been having some problems with their storage especially the one that are playing on a mobile phone yes it is understandable that genshin needs a lot of sapce because of the graphics and other resources to actually have a smooth gameplay(sorrey limit already)

You did nothing with the feedback given to you in regards to the resin system. You increased the cap from 120 to 160 but left the recharge rate untouched. We are still hard capped at 180 resin every 24 hours. 1 resin per 8 minutes. 180*8=1440minutes (24hours). Good job at having us fill our surveys to give feedback and then you just put in a "psuedo" fix that will appease those unaware of how the system works. Fix this trash system. Decrease the time between resin recharge.

It's the most beautiful RPG game I've played on android, and though the world kinda feels barren because it's so big with not a lot of activity, I assume this is a performance decision because it doesn't run consistently on 60 fps on my LG V30. My only gripe so far is that there's a lot of exposition in quest dialogs, it feels too much at times. There's a ton of stuff to find wherever you go and it doesn't have the tediousness of travelling a large expanse that usually comes with open worlds.

This game is a really fun game but there are some problems that come with the game. First off you need a good phone to play on mobile and if u don't u will have lots of problems with the game. Second the tutorial takes a very long time to complete for some reason I get that your trying to show us whats happening in the game but I don't like that it's takes so long to complete it. And we'll it's hard to level up ur characters if you need to travel place to get some papers?

I love this game. It looks really good, plays good, and the combat is fun. It's kinda tricky because you have to know the element combos and sometimes an attack might backfire, but I think once you figure out how it works that won't be a problem. Something I haven't tried but plan to do is using the same account to play on different platforms. I looked up to see if you could do that and people said yes, so if it's true that would be a bonus. üëçüèæüëçüèæüëçüèæ
Good(still not best for me but yeah good enough) best game i have ever played. Thank for the Glider.

An absolute beauty! Granted there are a few things that can certainly be improved and are already mentioned by most other viewers, the concept and gameplay are phenomenal, archon quests are pure goodness, only thing lacking is the late game content and convenience for late game grinding. All in all it's a solid game, perhaps the best in the genre at least on the mobile. Loved it!

I love this game very much and I would rate it 100/10. The graphs are good (but heats up since I play on phone), gameplay is hella good, and the characters are unique in every way! Although, it may require you to use some money money and doesn't nearly reward you with grinding your a*" off it's still a good game! It's free too!! Yay!

Great game and whatnot but 1. Glitches like...A LOT A lot of the time my gameplay resets because of these glitches and also I can't really play because I can't tell what's happening. 2. This goes along with the glitches but when it glitches it makes my whole phone crash I love the game and characters but the glitching is not ideal

Really bad rates for items. This game has a gambling system that preys on children and adults alike. The gameplay is nice but the system of getting characters or new weapons are very poor. The developers would require you to spend more than necessary compared to other gacha games. The number of repetitive 3 star weapons is also very high with a limited number of options. There is a higher chance of getting 100 pieces of each 3-star weapons than completing a set of 4-star weapons (1 each). Bad!

It's a good game story is good, (most) events are very fun, I really enjoy playing! However my good gaming experience has been deteriorating in each and every update due to the size of the game. Sure, I am fully aware that voice lines and quests can be Uninstalled thru the paimon menu, but its really annoying that you need to Uninstall them after each and every update you download so pls make it so if u delete files, they don't automatically download themselves every time u download the game.
This game is really addicting and the characters are so beautiful the Inviorment is really pretty there's a bunch you can do in this game luv it

I completely love this game I also have it on my PS4 but if I have to give them one suggestion which is a major one this game is so good that it made me go out and purchase a Moga XP5-X Plus controller for my phone. Which is a Samsung Note 20 Ultra and I completely love the controller but there's one problem this game is optimized to work with it at all. I hope to hear a response back from the development team that they're working on this. So I can use my controller

From this free game I've got more entertainment than most pay for games of the same caliber and the cross play between all systems allows me to continue playing on my phone anywhere after mainly playing it on PC. The graphics on this game are crazy good, they are just as good on phone as a high end PC with very little lag

Overall, Genshin Impact is a good experience. The storyline was refreshing and captivating. The graphics is stylized and absolutely gorgeous (at least when you have a nice phone or play it on PC). The combat is fun and generally enjoyable. The occasional gacha element is reasonable and within the range of acceptability, but sometimes it can get rather annoying. I'd definitely recommend trying this game out if you can but keep in mind that the game is centered around the gacha aspect.

So I've been playing for almost two months now and I would like to report a visual issue in game since patch 1.1. It's when I activate elemental sight, some of the ground becomes static with yellow, green, and red colors. It's kinda annoying especially when doing bounties. I hope this will be fixed soon :))

Great game. Story line is fun and progresses well, game is interactive and engaging, even when not following the story. The graphics and little details here and there are really well done and add to the immersive feel. There's always something to do and some way to have fun.

A lot of fun, but it lacks a lot of substance. Given time I think this game will be a 5 star game. The characters often have voice lines playing without their mouths moving. It isn't possible to change the keybinds which is a huge drawback for lefties.

After a year of playing this game I can safely say that it has many good aspects. It is a beautiful world with some very fun characters. Unfortunately there is no end game, lots of grinding for little reward, resin based so you are limited on what you can do and new characters are jusy getting worse. The direction of the game is unclear, design is getting stale and Mihoyo flat out does not appreciate it's player base. Was the years most beloved game, now everyone is trying to shut it down.

(My review won't stay up) when you start, the game is really good! the issue starts at higher Adventure Ranks, there are less and less things to do and even doing your daily commissions seems like a chore. It's a really grind-y game, very time demanding and it needs consistency since resin resets with time. Daily Commissions are boring and repetitive especially when you're looking for a specific one :/ Overall bad game because of the bad late game experience.

This game is meant to be played casually in my personal opinion. I have been playing it since release. The events are enjoyable and always give a little extra than you were expecting. There's always something I haven't done yet. When I'm absolutely lost, I'll look up a guide online and get back on track. I genuinely enjoy the game and the ability to swap from pc to mobile. Most importantly, I believe if you look up everything and try hard to "complete" the game, you lose out on the longterm fun.

This game for me was a 5 star when I first started playing, btw I started since launch, but after reaching endgame, all of it goes to the bin; lack of endgame, no balance patches for outdated characters, probably one of the worst anniv rewards ever, there so called anniv rewards are just advertisements for there own game, don't get me wrong, the game is enjoyable and beautiful, but only at a certain point, THIS GAME IS STRICTLY CASUAL

The game is great. The graphics, the storyline and the music. However, I'd recommend you use a newer device to play if you're using a mobile phone. As for my older mobile phone, it kept overheating and ended up crashing the game. But as for the newer mobile phone, which I am using now, it worked perfectly fine. But it still overheats a little bit. Overall: 10/10

Game, storyline, everything is perfect as I expected. So cool looking Anime's. Wonderful maps, addictive. But devices heats a lot from high end to the low end devices. Make sure the game should be stable enough and everyone might be able to play if we have more capacity of battery and heat decreases battery percentage and life. This disturbances the gaming as it's hard to hold them. One request,please make sure to give decrease the prices on in app purchases coz its hard to buy them coz I'm poor

Breathtaking. A gorgeous, stylized anime action rpg, with multiple characters each with a different play style. The game isn't pay to win or ad heavy and has such deep, expansive world lore the whole experience sucks you right in. This game is a joy, with exploration, tons to discover, and addictive and engaging combat, it's hard to put down

Whenever I start my game it just gets stuck on the bridge scene . It is infinetely just building up . And don't blame it on my device ,my device has 6 GB ram and 90 gb space left and it's good enough to support fortnite. It just stuck on the loading nothing else is there just the screen of bridge being build. Please fix my issue mi ho yo. I know that you create good games but I am disappointed

Been playing this game ever since its release and always looking forward for new regions. I definitely want to play till the end of this game. Graphics and designs are all gorgeous. Pulling for characters I wanted is what I love in this game, however, the genesis crystal purchase is too expensive. More than a hundred dollar in my currency but not even 1 pity (90 pulls). That's the only problem I have with the game so far. It makes me want to spend less honestly.

Great game, can't complain about much. I have a few problems though that bring it down a lot. No endgame content for veteran players. I haven't even played for 1 year and I'm almost out of content to fo outside of limited time content that is time gated. 2. Controls are difficult on mobile, especially using bow characters. 3. I can't minimize the game to open another app for even a second or it'll likely crash. Please optimize the game so I can minimize the game for a minute to open another app

Good game but the resin system needs a rework. It was fine when the game first came out due to limited amount of characters, but seeing as we have double the amount of characters to farm for now, the resin regeneration and cap needs to be much higher than before. Also, the game is also quite lacking in end-game content, with only the spiral abyss DPS check at the moment. If there could be some kind of boss raid co-op content would be much appreciated.

The highlight of this game is how ABSOLUTELY BEAUTIFUL the graphics are. The world-building and story line is incredibly captivating and is the best RPG / Simulation game for beginners, in my opinion. The controls and features are minimalistic in style so it wont overwhelm players. It will keep you playing ALL DAY, although I stopped playing for 3-5 months, only because I got bored waiting for Inazuma. But I'm back on this again.

Amazing experience, beautiful graphics, unique and intricate storyline, fully enjoyable without having to pay, and just overall a fantastic game. It quickly became addicting and one of, if not my favorite, game. The fighting system is unique and capitalizes off the games unique elemental system. The character designs are immaculate. The lore behind every character has me emotionally attached. The cinematics of this game are top tier. At times I forgot I'm playing a video game. I love Genshin sm
Everything is great, if I want to say a problem, it's just the amount of memory it needs, two gigs is too much.

Easily the game of the year! Amazing storyline, fun gameplay, and incredibly beautiful artwork at a free to play price. You'll hear a lot of criticism targeting gacha games, but the truth is you're the player and it's you who decide if you enjoy a casual or competitive pace. Edit: Played from launch and it's still at the top of my list, beating all other mobile games I've tried since

Rewards or not, this game is so beautiful and fun to play. Amazing story line, beautiful landscape, adoroable characters and mpc's, poweful bosses, and even more versatile characters to play. Its been one year since i started playing this game, and it still has the same effect since the day it was launched.

Been playing since launch and I've spent hours and real money on this game more than I've spent on any other games. I am satisfied but not perfectly satisfied as I was. I understand it could get repetitive and events that you don't want to do or feel lazy to do so(haven't missed any btw) what I like the most is the plot and storyline, the completeness feela of the game. Every patch feels some device/computer set up are starting to feel the pressure on this game, especially Sumeru update.

I love this game!! I have it on pc and mobile and I think it's great that you can switch between both. I don't know what kind of magic they used to make it t be able to run on phones but it still looks great and the whole map it still the same. The only thing that I don't like is not having the option to make your own controls but the layout they use is alright just saying it would be nice to be able to use a 4 finger grip. I know the game just came out so I'm excited to see all the updates.

I have a great time playing this game. It looks great, it feels great, it sounds incredible, and I only have a couple of complaints. One is that it's very hard to play on mobile, which isn't a big deal for me because I usually play on PC, but a bigger problem is how short the events are. I feel like I need to play a lot of hours a day to get the event wishes, and I get burned out. I don't think anyone likes that, and I think that it could be fixed by making Primogems more common and fate cheaper

Very cool graphics, and some designs characters looks very cool, i also like the skills and it looks very cool and everything. But theres one thing that can you say a one hint to do quest thingys? Sometimes i get confused what to do on quest like on snow quest, BUT i still like the game and i enjoy playing it im not even hating it its just sometimes i get confused but thats ok i can watch tutorial videos i watch them tho if i get confused to do the hard quest, but i hope you can add hints<3 :D

Havent played since the release of Eula (I had obtained all the units till then). I gave Mihoyo a long while to fix glaring issues with the game. These include a lack of meaningful content, and heavily paywalled characters. Yes you can use free ones just fine. It doesnt mean being stingy with characters is ok. Gameplay is fine but bland. We gave feedback on how to improve the game and they've rarely if ever materialized. This game is something that I personally will steer clear of in the future.
Ppl hate on this game bcz they think it's just a gatcha game but it's way more the story is amazing

Bruh loading screen graphics are the only thing that I can look at, it takes too much storage and slows the entire frickin phone down. I can't even play the game without my phone having a warning about it taking too much storage and is about to delete other data. It also takes a lot of data and battery. So yeah, its not that your game is bad, I just don't want my phone to explode.

Honestly love it. Loved it from the start. I stopped playing because I was so addicted to exploring. I'm back into playing it again because I can control myself now I think haha. If the reason why you play is exploring and the story content you'll never run out of stuff to do. If you're playing to whale and do end game content then you'll run through the game fast. I didn't like leveling my characters in the past and playing boss content but now am enjoying farming things for my characters

the game is great, very engaging. so far i have only one problem , i had finnished the city reputation quests levels in monstad level 1-4, my in game character is supposed to be awarded with blueprints and they are marked recieved already but i cant find the blueprints anywhere in my bag. can you help fix this. thanks.
This not just a game, it's slowly becoming a chores.

Amazing game. I can pass my whole day playing it. It's fun and the graphics are beautiful. The story is very good and I can't wait to see more. The reason I don't give the game 5 star is that the archon quest sometimes desapears out of nowhere. I just did the Inazuma archon quest where you fight the shogun army, once I finished the fight my quest desapeared. I tough that maybe I had to wait for the other part to come out but that's not it. My quest is gone. Please fix that.

It's a really good game and has a lot of content although you have to grind a lot it's still a fun game with all the events and new quests. Also I like how you can actually interact with the city and trees and everything in the world instead of just like a background you can actually go there to the place and interact with it.

Overall a pretty good game, but it gets boring pretty quickly and I wish there are new game mechanics introduced that aren't just a limited time event and can be played freely. Drop rates needs to be fixed, challenging domains and bosses and not getting what you want is really frustrating and discouraging and is one of the reasons why I got so sick of the game because of how repetitive it is. Characters gacha rates can be improved or make primogens easier to obtain.

Man, I actually think this game manages to do a lot right... but far more wrong. The adventuring part of the game which is also built up within the story as well dies off quickly as you progress and begins to feel less rewarding... shouldn't it be the opposite?? Among the other enjoyable aspects of the game they all give way in a similar manner to reveal the underlying gacha system, what could be the new standard for mobile games is nothing more than a fancy money grab and the devs know it...

Definitely the most intriguing game by far on my list, but I do want to point out that the gacha rates are pretty bad against 6-stars. Another thing is certain point of the game would start to behave weird and on one occasion crashing. I'm still leaving a 5-star rating just because it reminds me of Link on Switch!

Honestly such a good game. The graphics are amazing and the game play is extremely satisfying. I do have a few issues here and there, but the reason I'm giving 4 stars, is because of one thing. Devices. I really wish it was on all phones, because it would be easier so people who want to play the game on one device and not have other ones just to play a certain game can do that. Other than that it's honestly a good game overall. Would recommend to friends or family.

Make sure you have a capable device. Graphics wise, very good for a mobile game but still far away from the PC version. For characters, you will need to save up some primogems to be able to get the character you want, there's also a pity system, google for more info. Artifact system is bad as it requires a lot of grinding and there is no guarantee that you will get a good one. Lore wise, good enough to keep me attached to the story and it is one of the main reason of why I still play it today.

One of the best Android game ever played and it had nice graphic ,good character and even more The quest were awesome maps too it's fun adventuring the map but i would like it if the controls could be customized when I am in a hurry I used to accidentally press the elemental burst it's frustrating but overall the game is great love it thanks what makes this game a more amazing is the storyline man in some storylines I got emotional

Tbh the game kinda sucks on mobile but that is because the medium doesn't give the game justice. Do yourself a favor and play it on pc. I love almost everything about the game. The English VA is awesome, the visuals are astounding, the OSTs are mesmerising there is lore everywhere, the stories are touching, epic, funny and well written, almost all the characters are interesting in their way and all have their personality. The gameplay/theorycraft and optimization are deeper than it appears.

Not a big player of rpg game and only had maybe 3-4 hours in the game. Pretty fun to play, lookin forward to the story. EDIT: I've played the game for almost a year now. My focus has changed from playing the story to just trying to get my favourite characters and upgrading. This in itself isn't all that bad, but it does get boring after you have accomplished that and new contents is not released yet. Not to mention you can spend A LOT just to get the characters and weapons and to upgrade them!

I have been playing this game since it's launch and there has not been a day where I missed logging in to this game on my PC. Now that I have a decent gaming mobile phone, playing this game on the go has been a great experience. The only thing that upsets me is that the android version does not have a controller support despite me seeing news that the ios supports it. I would appreciate it if you all develop a controller support for android as well to make the experience more immersive.
I like the game! Its just so hard spiral abyss 2 chamber 1 is so hard and it's even harder to get characters

The game was all fine and dandy in the beginning, but they started getting greedy and lazy as the game went on. The rewards for the anniversary are the obvious but other than that there are more issues than i can type with the word limit. Kokomi being an absolutely useless unit, yoimiya having a broken kit, the rushed story quests and the list goes on. Some arent even that hard to fix. You can do better mihoyo.

Honestly i was kinda dissapointed because i have heard of this game online, i wanted to try it so i installed it. After i created an account and tried to enter the game, it says that you have to download something, which is normal. But there is a problem, a huge problem. I can't get into the game at all. It says that my storage space is too small (or something like that) i delete some apps and photos. Nothing happens. I delete more, still nothing happens.

Good polished game, and sets a new standard. But gets really repetitive. Events feels more like another amusement park you have visited before. Many things are simply recycled from assets that exists from launch, for example character animations used in new story cutscenes are obviously old ones. It feels very amateurish and low budget, even source film maker creators put more effort than this. Developers have gained their money already, and seems to change their focus to the new projects.

Been playing since 2020 and when it first was released it felt like there were so much to do. However, Genshin impact hasn't added any sustainable content since release except new domains and bosses each requiring 30 RESIN for the first 3 while the rest is 60 RESIN. Resin is capped out at 160 per day and one takes 8 minutes to regenerate so to get all your RESIN back it takes 1280 minutes. This is a major issue for players who are willing to commit to the game or have played for a long time.

A big chunk of the reason why this game is enjoyable can be attributed to PAIMON. She isn't your typical robotic companion; she's got a personality. You wouldn't want to miss her next emotional and very animated reaction. The gliding mechanism that's extensively used in mobility is a great experience. The world is riddled with interesting puzzles yearning to be solved. The BGM is so soothing and is unlike common trashy music in other games.
This game is amazing love the design of the world and i also love the design of the character and also love the voice but pls genshin add a skip button plssssss

I love everything about this game but the issues I am having are making it unplayable. For starters Everytime I get on the game it lags and after about a minute it completely stops and tells me that the game isn't responding every time I get on I have changed my settings to the lowest I could and It still doesn't seem to fix anything. If you could fix this bug then that would be great.

It is a really fun experience. It's the best MMO that I've played so far. The background story is captivating and all of the characters' designe is really really good. Also, great graphic and animations. It is worth all the space left in your storage memory üòÇ

I love Genshin Impact, you don't get many open world games that have anime styles to it! Though the Gacha system is meh, other than that it's pretty awesome. The character designs are good, I like Albedo best but I also love everyone else equally! The graphics are good too! Even if it's high GB and it lags, you can turn the graphics down to the lowest and it's still enjoyable!

The game is super great not gonna lie the scenery the characters the story the events but the rewards sometimes are lacking. Books that you get for leveling up talents does not match with it's difficulty. Adventurer rank too ,reaching at higher than ar 55 is tedious and the rewards for progressing is so minimal. Yep it's made like this for players to play more. This is not a rant. Just sharing what I think it lacks. An increase in rewards would be good.

Great game, no controller support, and no mention of controller support, yet iOS has it. I know it's probably more complicated than I think it is but it can't be that complicated. I'm a big spender when I play games and all of my money has gone elsewhere to other games. This company has missed so many opportunities for revenue from me and others and all they had to do was add something simple to the game.

After you finish the abyss there's noting to do, no end game content, lack of in game content by what I mean is too many web events, takes you out of the game to claim rewards. Massive burnout playing this game, like I've said there no end game goal for content to grind for, no achievement to strive for. As you play the game longer and longer you realize that alot of the content is recycled, with few and far between gameplay changes. Even the rewards for events are lackluster.

Couldn't create an account the way I wanted because their verification code included letters but I was only allowed access to numbers. When I tried to change to keyboard it automatically moved to password space leaving the verification code line blank. I tried repeatedly. So I registered via my Google acct and then it insisted I had no room for updating, which was not the case. This app stonewalled me the whole way :-(
I love this game u can join other worlds and play with friends u can also have fun exporting the big map and the story line!

It was so much fun in the beginning but at endgame, it's so grindy and you have basically nothing to do. Everything needs resin (artifacts, exp books, talent books, boss drops) and the resins takes ages to refresh. I stronger but in the end, what for? There's no endgame content I could use it for. The serenitea pot was great too in the beginning but that was until i realized, the load limit was too small for me to realize my ideal mansion. In the end, this is the final straw.

As the rate said. 2/5, Since 1.0 i Played this game and all that months ingame theres only one problem i had. Intense frame drops. Theres a problem in 1.4 i heard of crashing but it would be fixed sooner. But You should give an attention of optimizing the game for mobile. The Old settings were more better than the previous graphic settings. pls Hear me out. Its a good game but still, Problems might result of People quitting the game shortly.

you know, i thoroughly enjoy this game. the graphics are super nice, handling is also real good plus i get to explore a whole lot. the only downside is the wishing system... like how about you up the drop rate of the main character of the banner? I've been wasting so many primos to get what? tons of useless weapons, a few 4* and a 5* that isn't even on the banner!? thanks a lot üíÄ

It's really awesome and cool !!! Love the graphics and the story. The company has done really an amazing job with this game. Hats off to you guys. But can you do something about the climbing feature!? Character just keep on climbing even when I don't want it to. It's funny but can get irritating.

I finally got a phone (s23 Ultra 512/12) that can play this monster on highest with stableish 60fps (it drops rarely to 58 for a fraction of a second) And it's a clear winner among genre and why its dominating mobile gaming space, even after 3 years (or so) after its release. Seriously they nailed every aspect of it. Even the most cliche quests. And simplicity of the combat is what makes it so fun.

Okay, yes the anniversary rewards are bad, but I feel like we shouldn't give the game a bad review because of just that. Aside from the rewards, the rest of the game is really good! The scenery is great, the story is great, the gameplay is great, and the music is great. But, Yoimiya feels bad to play, Kokomi is useless, Chapter II act III is poorly paced, and the anniversary rewards suck. Mihoyo, I love this game, but please do better in the future.

It's definitely a cute and fun game, definitely worth a try if one is bored. My only real grievance with it is that it's hard to get any characters. Primocrystals take forever to accumulate it be much better that if you get 15 or 20 as rewards instead of 5. I quit once before because I could never get any decent characters or I got more weapons then I ever needed. Other then that pretty fun.

A really cool game and enjoyable as well. Nice character designs, backgrounds, locations, city designs, the naming of places and objects, and the bgm !! However I would give it a 5 star rating if you guys add a pvp mode like nothing fancy just a simple pvp where travels can challenge each other and fight. That would be a cool addition to it. Tho try not to make the file very big... I have seen many people delete this fantastic game due to storage issues. Even I couldn't play it for a long time.
Honestly Its a very good game the only problems are it's too grindy and quite buggy. But over all it's a great experience
Nweds a lot of space on your phone. Dont do it. I deleted so many apps and this stupid game still wont fit. I have a samsung note too. This is nuts

It's starts great but once you reach end game the lack of actual repeatable rewarding end game content/mode other than time attack (Abyss), the lackluster story writing of the latest update and for some reason the QOL issues that this game has really makes it hard to support it further (monetarily). If this continues i would just switch to be a casual F2P Player and support other games worth my money.

Love the game and graphics. My only issue is that when you're traveling, you sometimes enter a quest without realizing it and it locks co-op mode until you beat it. I wish there was a way to cancel quests that you are not ready for but other than that, great game

I play this on pc and it's awesome! I would recommend if you like anime. It takes up a lot of space on mobile devices. I absolutely love the graphics and the story. Just one problem, adventure rank accession sometimes they can be annoying. Overall great!üíö

i am addicted to this game! the graphics are good and so well as the story and quests! i would suggest to have a trading system of characters if we want to trade with our friends. I would also suggest to make Spiral Abyss a multiplayer game. Thats what i want to say, hope the version 1.1 will be awesome :D edit: so far, this latest update is cool! keep up the good work :)

i like the graphics, lore, and- literally everything but the anniversary rewards. I thought we would be given something more unique and different from other events, although i actually like that mihoyo/you showed our progress. But as a player who has been playing for quite a long and spent money on the game, the rewards are disappointing.

Real great game I am loving it! Buy there is no controller support for Android??? Isn't on PS4 and PC?!? Kind of disappointed to be honest it would make the game way more playable. One last thing, the username and email is partially displayed when on launcher but Phone number fully display when linked, not really ideal when want to be same and want to stream in the same time.

It is a good game ... but I can not get over how uncomfortable the in-game UI feels. The fixed positioning of the movement joystick into the bottom left corner is so awkward that I essentially can not move my character backwards at all. The left joystick needs to be placed higher up on the screen or be allowed to follow the players movement. I recommend the joystick settings on wildrift as a good example of customizable in-game UI.
Overall this game is good. But after update last week why my account can't login the game?? I already change my password and neither happens.

A lot of stuff getting worse by the update. The latest archon story was rushed. New characters are broken in a bad way. Spiral abyss is not hard but more of a dps-check which increases each update. There is still no update to the end game. The only thing good are the events which are fun but they are not even permanent and new players can't even experience them once they are gone.

I've started on 2.8 this was a great experience for me. It has great graphics beautiful characters and scenery! The quests are very detailed and the co-op is amazing! I recommend this game for people who like going on adventures and battle fields. My luck may not be so much in this game but this game was really fun<3! Reco for download ‚ô°‚ô°‚ô°‚ô°
I was just playing yesterday and now I can't even open the app it's like when I try to open it, it keeps backing up and just return to my home screen

Please, please, please fix the glitch with the cg. I had to go to youtube to watch the CGs because the CGs in the game keeps freezing, I cant appreciate the story this way. But other than that, I really enjoy the game. It's so addicting! There's much to do and it's really fun. Please continue to make the game better and add more events to keep the players occupied.

While this game is amazing it has a few flaws for on chromebook , don't get me wrong its a good game i have it on my phone but for chrombook it's not that great, First of all i spent over an hour trying to get past the intro. I'm still not past it due to immense amounts of lag the screen is also blank. I have no clue what happend either. Another thing is on chrombook you should add pc controls or the option to change them instead of just having moble controls, thanks!

Excellent fusion of JRPG and gacha. Genshin does a great job of combining elements to make the gaming (and farming) experience fun. The graphics are beautiful, the characters have different playstyles for you to choose from, the story and quests are fun, and the gacha is one of the most forgiving I've ever seen. We get an event every 6 weeks, which keeps the game interesting even after you've finished all available quests. Definitely recommend checking this one out!

Gacha impact is a game where you collect scantily clad mostly under age women and some dudes and fight monsters. The game is great. Gameplay is responsive and flashy. The game falls apart pretty quick. Pay your time or pay with money to make stupid inconveniences go away once. Progression is really important in games and this game wants to monetize that to encourage you to spend as much money as possible. Games get so much better than this.

Sooooo play it on pc, meh, combat is enjoyable, play it on mobile, yeah i better find another game to invest my time with. Controls is not that flexible, for a game company that already has history in mobile gaming. The cpu usage is high due to its being open world game. Gameplay is boring after a while. Too many thing to gather for weapons that can be change after an update. Enemy is not quiet hard, mostly rehash recycled ones. Graphics on performance mode is good.
I love playing dialogue simulator with a little pinch of adventure

It's a well made game but there are two issues - Once you are caught with the story, the game is pretty boring after some time, the daily quests suck, so little limited resin sucks, not much to do in co-op, free primogem distribution is so little(ik they are trying to do business but still), etc etc But good graphics for mobile, very nice music and story so far

As a game known for its financial and tech jcal investment, the quality truly shows. A deep lore, an e chanting storyline, a complex battle system, an unmatched graphic quality, beautiful music, and an endless exploring in one of the most if not the largest open world in mobile gaming. This game truly deserved its spot of being the best rpg i have ever played.

It's a good game when you compare it with its contemporaries. It has a nice story and the character designs are good as well. The gacha rates are abysmal though and I do hope it improves in the future. The controls are easy enough and the concepts are explained in game. It is still in its first year so I do hope that with the support this game has, that it'll improve immensely in the near future.

I play on PS4 but I decided to review here. I used to really love this game and I still do but after you reach AR50 there's nothing to do anymore. This game feels more like a chore than an actual game which really sucks because when I first got my PS4 the first game I've ever downloaded was Genshin Impact. The quests are draining, artifact drop rates are horrible so it takes more than a month to finish building a character, gacha rates suck, resin system is a huge issue, things need to change.

Started off great albeit having lots of bugs especially on the first few patches. Fortunately, most of them are already fixed but in game events are repetitive and boring. Some storylines are great but after you've finished it, it's simply boring you just login for daily commission and to spend resin. Spiral Abyss can be cleared in the span of 1day or less as a casual spender. The only excitement I can feel in this game is the gacha but even the characters now are simply underwhelming or clanky
best rpg game. but the size is too much.

Y'all messed with the graphics in a previous update and made the game look and run absolutely awful. The game takes up way too much space, and now only the whales enjoy this because the game's balance only favors those who spend a lot on it. Then there's that trash camera that constantly hides behind grass. You have to upgrade EVERY DAMN THING and unless you're spending alot, you'll be stuck. What waste of potential. This is a sad hill to die on. Had to uninstall.

So far Im loving the game. The graphics are amazing. I can run at the highest settings 60fps on my phone with a Mediatek Dimensity 1000+ inside. The gameplay is great and the ability to play on mobile and PC with the same save is awesome. The only thing missing is controller support.

Genshin Impact is a great adventure without an entry barrier. Exploration is similar to Breath of the Wild - collecting, climbing, gliding. However, combat is a fluid dance b/w managing your party's abilities and chaining attacks. The characters are all distinct with unique personalities. The story? Filled with beautiful cutscenes, lore, and voice acting. A visually impressive game. Edit: decreased score due to low gacha rates and freemium currency. I've hit soft/hard pity for over half a year.

Have been playing this game since the first month of MCO(Covid outbreak). And it has helped entertain me through tough times. I stopped playing for 3 months on 2021 because my device can't take it no more. I heard that there are new, fresh contents coming in the game and it gets me excited to play again. This is by far the best adventure game I played!‚ô°‚ô°

So I really like the game, for the most part. However during the battle with the electro cube thing it would just reset and I could not beat it. My friends have also had this trouble. The rest of the game is just fine. That bug just really upset me since I need the drops from it to upgrade my characters. I understand that this is a really big game, so I have no trouble waiting for fixes.

Amazing game, it's easy to play and has fantastic graphics, the only issue is it takes it a very long time to load cutscenes, I think this is because it's built closer to a console or pc game, but it still is fun. However, you can't really call the limited character banners "banners" because the "pity" (guaranteed 5 star summon) doesn't guarantee the rate ip character you are going for.

It made my mobile restart 2 times now. With 2.8 version it has been the worst gameplay. ‚Ä¢ If I go on playing Mona's domain, the screen freezes every 5 secs mostly. ‚Ä¢ In domains, enemies appears, like 30 secs after starting it. ‚Ä¢ In open world, when the enemies appears and you kill them all, you have to wait like more than a min to get the energy particles and sometimes the energy particles never come. ‚Ä¢ Also, after watching the Sumeru's graphics, I am quite worried about my further gameplay

Game keeps freezing up & crashing my Pixel 3a üòë No gamepad support. Tired of game developers not including support for gamepad controls that would make games like this one much more enjoyable to play on a small screen. The game is beautiful and has great voice acting, but instead of making it 100 percent complete, they decide to skip on something very useful and wanted by many. Who knows if they'll add gamepad support later, but it's something that should be there from day one üòë

Fun adventure game. Happily I haven't ran into any pay walls yet. But my two irritating complaints, no fov setting(beautiful world but can't see much at a timeüôÉ) and the lack of controller support! This game really needs to add that right away, it would make the experience immensely better.

Its a good game for newbies but as an end game it has several problems. There is no end game content for testing maximum potential of builds and characters. Also artifact drop rates and resin system is so annoying too.. After doing the story quest once a month you really don't have other things to do, its all boring daily commissions and weekly activities. there is also boring non-combat events too(cooking,taking pics) For a better experience in combat this game truly need an end game content

The game is amazing from story, mechanics, exploration, etc. They put so much energy into creating the combat system. To be honest its one of the most fun rpg combat system I have played. Sadly they don't care about putting it to use. And based on Developer statement they have no interest in putting any content that actually makes use of characters abilities/artifacts/foods/team building etc. Therefore as lovely and interesting all those characters are, they are and will be sadly just eye candy.

I love this game for its sense of progression but also just for chilling. It has such a beautiful environment and all the characters are well designed and gorgeous. I love the teapot! Guys, you get to create a pocket dimension in a teapot and that's your home instance. Along with furniture, you can even stage characters as companions in your home! I love this game!
Great until it isn't. The app gets so big that it is insufficient storage. I deleted it at 26GB. That's insane

I don't know about endgame yet, but after 20 hours of playing, i gotta say, this is one of the best gatcha/rpg games i have played this year. I mostly play apex legends and guild wars 2, so this is probably a breath of fresh air for me. A type of game that's new, laid back and refreshing to play with. I love the anime style inspired art design, the combat and story. Sure, it borrowed a lot from the Zelda switch game but something that's Cross-save and cross platform? Dont mind if i do! Awesome!

Good game, cheesy at times but tolerable. Three stars because I'm stuck trying to light some alters... but it's not working. And it's a main quest I can't get done because of it. So I've concluded it's a bug, but trying to contact the devs is a PITA, so I gave up after wasting 20 minutes.

So far it's a lot of fun! I really hope they add controller support because the controls are a little unresponsive at times with the touch screen controls. There is a key bindings section in the settings that is blank so I'm hopeful!

I really enjoyed Genshin! But it did run into some problems with my phone considering it's size. On my brother's phone it was very laggy partially because of the size and also because he chose the wrong region. On my phone, it crashes half of the time which I find a bit annoying sometimes. I also kinda quit the game for a while out of pettyness but overall, genshin is a fun game! The gameplay mechanics and it's lore are really fun, kinda sad about being f2p though.

Game play is great, music is great, plenty of quests starting off your game save. Grinding gets a little tough when you level up multiple characters but overall, great game play. Really fun. Only rate 4 star because it doesn't have an option to connect a controller. I will change to 5 star then.

Wow just wow. Downloaded yesterday and am loving it. I'm not to far into it been exploring and doing side quests mainly. But the artwork incredible. The gameplay very well done. I love games that you can level up your character and weapons get multiple characters to use that have there own purpose. The best phone game I have ever played.

Genshin started to randomly kick me out of the game. It stops on the loading screen and has been kicking me out ever since this event. This is app has crashed 10+ times. I Uninstalled and reinstalled to see if it would fix the issue but nope. edit!: after 3 months, they finally contacted me and asked if I was still experiencing the problem. They messaged me saying they skipped over my email & asked if I was still experiencing an issue. No compensation or anything. Just a half-assed apology.

I have been waiting for a game like this for so long. Throught out the years, all the mobile games I have tried are like jokes, chest, card, etc. No matter how fancy they made it look like. On the other hand, PC or console game feels too hard core for me at the same time. I felt I was left alone not belong to any of the games target user. Genshin is the exact game that I have been waiting for. I can casually explore and do quest on my phone and do some hardcore fight on PC. I just love it!
Other than a HUGE download at the beginning, long loading times, and lagging the game itself is awesome. As much of a console game this is though, I can deal with the times.and glitches.

Love this game but i'm currently having problems all of a sudden with opening the app. It goes on the loading screen like the white introductory screen but after that the entire app closes and won't open or work. I tried uninstalling & reinstalling multiple times but it still wont work and I really don't know how to fix it, it's a bit frustrating as I love this game and play it daily :(

This game is quite fun! I love the designs of the characters! I'm so glad I downloaded it! However, there's one small bug. When I try to this one quest for the poem, it doesn't budge even though I've found the thing. So, if you could fix it! That would be greatly appreciated. Thank you :).

Extremely good game, seamless transition between platforms and little to no bugs. A true masterpiece. It's greatness is only lessened by some major audio bugs (at least on the pixel 4 xl) it sometimes becomes crunchy and staticy, very difficult to understand. Otherwise would be a perfect 10/10

It's a good game and f2p friendly, I just installed this after a long time I left, but it has has a very troublesome problem which you were downloading the resources and suddely the WiFi become sucks or you quit halfway, your current progress will be loss as you'll start to the very beginning of your download, the game can't detect its game file, such a waste of time.
Good graphics, it's smooth, my only problem is the amount of primogems we get, it'd be nice if we got more especially for f2p

This game is good though it needs to be updated more recently! There is a bug in my phone where I get stuck at adventurer rank 4 it just stops the mission there so I cant continue it plsssssssss fix this! I got good internet and I didnt run background apps yet it still bugs! I will make it 5 after you fix the bug because overall its a good game you just need to fix this pls üò¢

Awesome game, one of the best I've played in ages, I'm addicted. Asia server is better for Australians ping. There isn't any stupid auto play / auto run or energy mechanics. English dialogue / voice acting is really well done. Great game and combat mechanics, doesn't yet appear to be heavy pay 2 win (pay to progress faster I assume), I haven't even been asked for money in my 3 days of playing (or needed to). Story and world is also very captivating, its a must try game.

Solid game voice acting is appreciated. There are some network errors, and they can be annoying. The way to get characters is money intensive and not really RNG more like spend a certain amount to get that character but call it having a chance to get it early. They should fix this system, or make the characters available for direct purchased as well.

For a mobile game, it's great! For a PC title, it's lacking big time. Compared to other mobile mmos, this one is a fresh of breath air with its anime like graphics and awesome combat controls. Compared to other PC anime titles, its very hard to get past the energy restrictions that you see in almost every gacha game. We also need more customizable options. At least let us change outfit colors and have cosmetic attachments, similar to other games like Warframe or the vast majority of mmos on pc..

The graphics is unquestionably in a whole new level and the character is designed well so that the developer can a attract a group of people. Anyway my question is why would I have to stand besides a Statue to recover my health and why is literally everything related to statue? You could have made a method to recover health by drinking potion or by some sort of element which the player can carry all the time. And tbh this gameplay reminds me of pagan culture which is totally unnecessary.

I adore this game and spent money on it for in game purchases because I honestly think they deserve it, because of the top notch quality. But as I keep playing, I keep noticing problems with the basic structure of the game. Not only does it drastically fall off in content as you enter the endgame, it starts feeling like a daily chore because of the resin system. But mihoyo always seems to be coming up with exciting new content in the form of events. Its easy to recommend.

I don't care about what other people think. But for me, this is my first game that really, really to my liking. The lore, the animation, the designs, the physics, the mechanics and MOST IMPORTANTLY, F2P FRIENDLY!! There are events in every update, which is a fun way to enjoy adventures in Tevyat and really help me to enjoy the lockdown. This game has so much memories together when there were times I can't get to meet my friends. I hope to see the end of this game together ‚ú®

The game is wonderful, if you liked Breath of the Wild or skyrim, theres a good chance you'll enjoy this game. There are timed mechanics like most other mobile games, and it does have a hero collection system based on using in game gems to get 'rolls' for heros and weapons. This does not detract from the game, as the real emphasis is picking your desired playstyle, whether it be maining 1 hero or having a rounded team. My ONLY warning is take your time. Enjoy the game. Don't try rushing it.

Best game un the world, I love the graphics, the lore for the quests is always wow, the fact you have such a huge world to explore is also wonderful, there are so many faces to this games including getting new characters,building them,exploring a beautiful world,playing with other players, you can have your own theories,the lore is really good and you meet Goss and there problems. In other words, this game has everything along with wonderful graphics and characters. LOVE IT
This game is incredible but it requires a snapdragon like chipset for you to have the high graphics:( 8.5/10)

The game play is accurate, but the pictures and ads portray the gameplay itself as very clear. The game is very blurry for mobile and at the best settings very pixelated.. I'm told this wasn't always the case, how do I fix the graphics to match the advertisements shown? I have a pretty high end phone as well, snap dragon 888 with 12 GB ram, I don't know what else it could be. If the graphics were fixed this would be an easy 4 stars maybe 5.
This game is really good but the only problem is there are close to no methods to get primogems once you get to high ar please add more ways to get primos if you are reading this

Not perfect, but certainly a good time, especially when you have some friends to chat and play. The events are repetitive, but it keeps you coming back to play this game at least. Rewards are pretty meh, but enough to pull for some of your favourite characters. Saving up for some time makes it possible to get even more copies and make your main character even stronger. At the end of the day it's still a gacha and they try to earn their money(even when the rewards kind of feel underwhelming).

The world, characters, story and elementals fight style... all of them just simply amazing. I am eager to see how this game evolves. We still have areas to unlock which means more stories and environment to explore. I am proud to witness this game since the beginning.

I have been playing this game for almost a year and have enjoyed it ever since! I really love the open world aspect of the game and the stunning sceneries. The OSTs are also beautiful. I enjoyed most of the stories in the game and the voice-acting that comes with. The game is pretty friendly to non/low spenders, where 4 stars are still useful and playable. I hope that the future content would keep me playing in the future. Keep up the good work!

Fun experience while playing it. I spend lots of time exploring and solving puzzle! It's f2p friendly too. Just do coop when you can't defeat the boss. But do find a good coop partner. And become stronger! Only certain boss need to be defeated as single player. But no worry, as once you become stronger, you can defeat it! Happy exploring =)

This game is so much fun. There are a few things once you finish the initial quests. But, nothing to bad. It becomes a slow grind and the cost to lvl new characters limits my want to get new. Resin is slow. Like, REAL SLOW. Other than that I still enjoy my time playing.

My experience with the game has been very decent due to lack of actually being able to save properly unlike other gacha games ive played it become really difficult getting any characters whatsoever that on top of the anniversary rewards which were godawful drops the game to 1 star. Gear system is fine really but resin system shouldnt exist in an open world game.

Definitely a good game,I like the features and gaming experience.Graphics are good but there are a lot of quests with bug,I have two world quests that I cannot finish because of the bug and it's kind of pissing me off but overall this is a really good game and most of the players especially the one's with high AR are very nice.I just hope the bug can be fixed.

This version of the game both looks, runs, and feels worse than the PC version. This version doesn't even correctly recognize the refresh rate of my display, and chugs on my device despite it having 8gb of RAM and a Snapdragon triple 888, which leaves the app a ton of overhead that it isn't even using, which makes absolutely no sense.

Ill be honest, I adore this game. For being a free single player open world storyline with the options to join your friends in the fun it is beautiful and the story is so fun. You do have options too pay for stuff in the game to make it easier or to get that certain character but honestly for those that are too poor too... You can still play and adore this game. The music is too rank and the character designs.... *Chef's kiss* I had to come on here because rate bombing this game is a damn sin.

Beautiful game, but there are additions that I hope will be added For example the Arabic language Increase daily mission rewards At least 80 primo I think this is what I am asking so please think about it

So overall it's a pretty good RPG game it has tons of characters I can choose from and an interesting story but it started to do this weird thing that results the game to crash multiple times I'm playing on mobile and this a very big issue since it sometimes interrupts my gameplay so I hope you can do something to fix but it's a pretty good game though Ive grown pretty attached to it

I absolutely ADORE this game. The graphics are beautiful and the story is just amazing, not to mention the characters are beautifully designed with likable personalities that makes me just fall in love with the game. However, ever since the 3.4 update came out, my genshin impact has been stuck on "Pending" every time I tried to update it. Is there any reason for this? Please let me know..
The Fontaine is the biggest beauty in the GI. I love the characters, big map like in TLOZ, and builds for 1000000 damage.

No matter what anyone says, it is not a pay-to-play game. You do not need to open your wallet to succeed at all! You just have to grind a little bit, but honestly, that is nothing new for this style of game. This game is absolutely beautiful from the graphics to the game play. I have had the game since release, and I still play daily. The number of things to do obviously decreases, but they do drop new events and are still expanding the map! Please be aware how gachas work before playing!

This is one of the very few mobile games I am willing to give a 5 star to AND without even being asked to do a vote. Every content is very much doable without paying a single penny, I didnt experience any adds, graphocs are nice and well optimized it runs smooth on my 300$ phone, english dub is amazing (tried japanese too its also great) controls are not too clunky despite needing to use a joystick. The only thing im dissattisfied mostly is with how "Resin" works but they are trying to change.

This would be 5 stars if it had controller support. That aside, it's honestly the best of the best that you can get on mobile. I've been splitting time between PC and mobile, personally. The cross saving is great. The gacha honestly doesn't interfere. You can play the entire game free and still unlock everything, just slower. This would be a damn near perfect game if they'd add controller support.

Great game, doesn't use to much data when I'm out and about. Awesome story, character development and all around a really great time. Walking and climbing can be a little challenging at times, especially for timed challenges. But other than that, not a single complaint :D

Really good so far. You need to work hard to find the chest and di quest to level up as a rank adventurer. You also need to think what to use and prioritize so the game is good for me so far. No need to pay money to grt characters too. Need more farming that's it! But it will also be good if we can have options to build our own character starting with their looks and powers. That will be awesome! Please look in my request devs.

Way exceeded my expectations for a cell phone game. Feels like a console game. Sort of reminds me of Zelda games. The only thing that could be better is the leveling system. Most 'experience' is gained through acquiring items and 'spending them' to level up. I wish it was more dynamic there.
The game is good and fun to play, the only thing is, obtaining characters is very hard for non top-up players..

Genshin impact has a lot of pros, like an interesting combat system, or a well designed world and lore. Unfortunately, it is a Potemkin village of a game, designed to rope you in with addictive gameplay loops before you realize just how many problems it has. There is no permanent endgame content, so if you log in daily you'll spend most of your time ...waiting for things to improve. You experience the game through characters, but character variety is low, and character's are poorly balanced

Makes device super hot and unplayable for a game that requires a lot of time and focus for a mobile. The problem arises when you don't have time to sit down for a good 30 minutes to get things done and still need to manually travel. It starts to feel repetitive and the game does not have an option where it respects your time. It's alright at best but there's nothing left to keep my investment aside from the occasional coop. Too much to grind for as they keep releasing new characters.

I love this game to bits and I've been playing since it came out. But oh my God please stop crashing. I don't even mind the lags, I couldn't finish any of the daily commissions because the game kept crashing. Somedays it's worse than others, but today is really really bad. I couldn't even sprint unless I want it to crash immediately. Please I'm begging for the mobile version to be a little more bearable.

To be fair, it's a great game. Great graphics and controls. I wish you'd add a feature to remove old files or videos that aren't needed for save files that are far in the story so there's no need to keep that huge a file for phones with small storage space. I used to be able to casually play this on my phone until the ZhongLi update, now I can't. I've had it uninstalled and although I have it on PC, it would be great to still have it on my phone so I can play it anytime and anywhere I want.

Beautiful game but touch issues on display, it really reminds me of BOTW Zelda which is why I love it.. very impressive for a mobile game the only issue I am starting to notice is that during dialogs or selecting certain items the touch doesn't seem to want to register within the first couple if taps and I know for a fact there is nothing wrong with my display. Hopefully that gets looked at. Once that is fixed then this game is definitely worth 5 stars!

One of the greatest online gaming experiences I've ever had! I love the likeness of "Breath of the wild" it's very much similar and it's great for pickup and go play. Now on to the "pay to play" aspect, yes it's there but unlike some many other games, it's not a ripoff in the slightest! You actually get a lot of bang for your buck should you choose to pay to win. Great job! And keep the fluent updates coming!

This is actually a lot of fun, the story is interesting, game play is solid, and graphics are great. Unfortunately its a bit rough to use on-screen controls and there is no controller support. Would love to use a mouse/kb or a Bluetooth controller so I could get this up on a big screen.

Base on my experience the game have so many bugs and some glitches. For example a bug that when you knocked an enemy and he's in airborne state and there's a wall behind, the enemy is still hanging mid air. And there's the Geo skill that you summon a barrel, the enemy stays up there and sometimes while doing a combo, if you get closer to the barrel your character will climb and your combo is cancel. But I love your game just add some buyable items on the shop and fix some bugs and glitches.

overall, its a really nice game. However my lag is sometimes horrible, especially during the first cutscene. The quality also doesn't seem to be anywhere close to where it should be, from what I've seen. I'm not sure if this is just my computer, or if this is just a general bug with Genshin, as my other devices either don't have enough space for it, or they're not compatible. I hope to see less lag in my future gameplay. Thank you!
I have opened and played well but charector stuck somewhere and game crash and now I try to open loading but every time to crash please solve the problem

best game ever. I am surprised about bad reviews! People are really demanding and rude especially because the amount of work behind this game is huge. You don't have to pay to progress as someone states. You have to be able to play, and it doesn't require specials skills. It is an open world game, free. Maybe the bigger existing. There are a lot of mission, stories and 40+characters. The only side is the memory and RAM, obviously it requires a lot, but is understandable.

Dl the game took a long time even with hi speed wifi. I was constantly felt lost as it was hard to get my bearing right with the location map on left corner. The Navi is useful but the trail drops off often so I have to click the Navi icon again and again. Running place to another is slow and far so if I can teleport straight away it will be so much neater. The temple quest has a min level requirement and I still don't know how to level up quickly other than eating envelopes. Tough game.

I kinda want a mount rider for traveling in the land so that you can enjoy the scenery more, like the wave rider in the water bodies of inazuma and sumeru, it is nice and relaxing. When your questing, teleporting from place to place is convenient but it gets boring, and walking is slow, while running/dashing needs stamina and boring. Climbing automatically is annoying, when your fighting your character suddenly climb on something. Can climbing be manual? Overall the game is good and its fun.

initially the game was AWESOME! hands down it was the best I had ever played wrt graphics, scenery, characters and STORY. the only disappointment is not the rewards but the lack of consideration towards the player base. The story and world building is hands down the best but the pace at which updates roll are slow but frequent. the amount of time it actually takes for the story to move on is too long and tires out many people like me (minimal spender). And if you miss a day you feel like you've lost something precious you've been building up. I don't want more rewards heck i'm fine with what we already have but please put more lore and give characters like lisa, kaeya and amber more love so we can like them for who they are as characters and not the colorful numbers that pop up on the screen. Oh and where is ludi harpastum? we were supposed to get that too right?

Great game, waiting for Android controller support to really get attached. The touch controls are not bad though. Beautiful scenery, fantastic combat and an open world that's a pleasure to explore. ................. Came back to update in 2023. Still no controller support. Stopped playing all together waiting for it. Tower of Fantasy is a better option if you're looking for the console experience. ..... Update - still no controller support. I've all but forgotten this game. Still holding out.

I played since launch and the game was truly beautiful and addicting at first. Lots of potential wasted; There's no skip buttons on dialogue and the quests are starting to become a slog of filler dialogue. Extremely repetitive lategame, open-world becomes a chore and fights are braindead or gimmicky. Strict and stingy event schedule where if you're a new player or missed it, a major story event is gone forever due to no archive or re-runs, essentially throwing their dev's time into the trash.

Overall this game is ok. Biggest problem for me is the controls. This game doesn't give you any joystick options and the fixed joystick is too low. It makes combat difficult cause it limits mobility when you can't go toward the camera easily. It's also hard to turn the character because the character switch ui is right where your other hand naturally lands to move the camera angle. I also wish the camera default was angled a little higher, because bushes and grass make it really hard to see.

This game gets a lot of unnecessary hate. While it isn't perfect, the constant stream of new game mechanics through constant events keeps things interesting and the core gameplay of exploration, combat and elemental combinations is very interesting and exciting! Gacha system can be a bit stressful but it is literally optional (all the characters you need to progress forward in the game are free).

This used to be a 5 star review because of how great I thought the game was in the beginning. I love the graphics, characters, and nations, but there are just so many glaring issues recently that I cant ignore. The story used to be my favorite part of the game, but in inazuma it quickly became convoluted and frankly, boring. The resin system is flawed and makes it impossible to grind. Endgame gameplay is non existent. Rewards for playing are very low and really make it hard to want to continue.

So far a nice experience. The controls are easy to handle, inventory space isn't an issue, character leveling is satisfying, the ads ARE NOT overwhelming :) All in all a lot of small really good things combined to make this nice game. They even reward you for time down during maintenance (as a new player I was eager to get back into, and this helps me save up for whatever they're worth!) *another pro*

ive been playing since the first venti banner. of course, the game is really fun. the character design and landscaping is beautiful, and the gacha system honestly isn't that bad. the only problem for me is that it's really overwhelming. every day, you have to grind or else you miss out. spend your resin before it caps, grind the event before it ends. it's the perfect game for burnout. other than that, it's good- i just can't play it for too long without a break.

Beyond my expectations. Music, visuals, voice acting, gameplay, stories, lore, all for free still blows my mind. The paid gacha system seems really expensive for the low roll rates, but it's not something you need to do. It definitely adds to the value of the good items, but if it means more content is added!

Exceptional. The new standard in this genre while flawlessly incorporating RPG, action-adventure, resource gathering, crafting and more; all in an open world that's highly interactive; boasting excellent graphics, smooth game play, voice overs, rich music, and an immersive story line with side quests. Dev's have really created a master piece here. Only drawback is the game takes a good amount of processing power: (note 10+) works fine,(note 8) cutscenes glitch a little w/ graphics set at lowest.
